sanskrit_verse:
विप्रः शुध्यत्यपः स्पृष्ट्वा क्षत्रियो वाहनायुधम् ।
वैश्यः प्रतोदं रश्मीन् वा यष्टिं शूद्रः कृतक्रियः ॥ ५.९९॥
transliteration:
vipraḥ śudhyaty apaḥ spṛṣṭvā kṣatriyo vāhanāyudham |
vaiśyaḥ pratodaṁ raśmīn vā yaṣṭiṁ śūdraḥ kṛtakriyaḥ || 5.99||
sph_interpretive_translation: A Brahmin becomes pure by touching water; a Kshatriya, by touching weapons and conveyances; a Vaishya, by touching goad, reins, or staff; a Shudra, by performing service.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is differentiated by capacity for consciousness alignment
Purification is contextual to varna-specific dharma
Responsibility flows from role-determined action capacity
Restoration logic operates through varna-appropriate conduct
Consciousness alignment is facilitated via structured role engagement
executable_legal_axioms: IF action == purification_action FOR agent.varna THEN status.purity := TRUE
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving ritual or social purity disputes, the Supreme Court shall recognize that purification protocols are not punitive but restorative, determined by varna-appropriate action capacity. Responsibility lies in correct role enactment, not moral failure.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that purity is not abstract but operationalized through varna-specific acts. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential alignment with one's causal role. Proportional responsibility arises from role-capacity, not transgression. This upholds Dharma without invoking punitive consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate purification completion process aligned with varna-specific praxis
Assign role-appropriate restoration task to reaffirm dharma alignment
Verify consciousness reintegration through correct action repetition
Ensure societal reacceptance upon verified completion
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through consciousness-aligned action. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the ultimate adjudicator.
